title: I'm 30. And a failure. What's next?
content:
It’s 2024. And I’m going to turn 30 soon. I feel so old, and unsuccessful… 

Over the last many years, I’ve followed the traditional path of going to a school…then college. 

22 years, spent just like that. Following the society.

Thankfully, wisdom dawned on me and I spent the last 8 years in experimentation. 

3 years in trying out different roles. 

1 year in writing a book. 

And the last 4+ years in diving deeper into the field of Marketing. 

I gotta say…nothing captures my heart and attention like Marketing. 

I feel like I can solve any marketing / growth problem in the world. 

And I can make as much money as I want to. IF making money was the goal. 

But there is a secret to everything. The secret to great marketing, is, 

A passionate marketer…combined with a passionate builder. 

This combination is dangerous. 

This combination will captivate the hearts of people like no other. 

And we’ve seen this combination in the past… 

Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak 

Bill Gates and Paul Allen 

Larry Page and Sergey Brin 

among others… 

The truth is, I’ve not yet come across a passionate builder. 

Someone who is as passionate about their craft, as I am about mine. 

I do believe that passion or love of the craft is crucial for success, and to produce great work. 

People ask me whether I know ‘X’ or ‘Y’ or ‘Z’ skill in marketing.

And my answer to them is that such ‘skills’ are readily bought and sold on marketplace platforms like fiverr and Upwork. 

It is a commodity. 

But passion is not.

You can’t buy passion. You can’t buy passionate people either. 

Because they don’t “work” for money.

This passion is the single biggest reason why I’m confident about picking up any skill within marketing and becoming good at it within 6 months. 

So now that I know that I’m passionate about marketing and want to devote my life to it, what’s next? 

Success. 

Unfathomable, unstoppable success. 

If I know that I have the talent to be great and world-class in my field, yet I don’t utilize it to achieve success, what’s the point? 

Success in my field is actually tied to revenue. 

The more the marketing contribution to revenue, the more ‘successful’ one is.

So, if I have to achieve revenue, I need to sell. 

If I have to sell, I need a product worth selling. 

Whether a product is worth selling or not, depends on the state in which it was created. 

If it was created solely to “sell”, it is most definitely not worth selling.

If it’s created out of a state of inspiration, we can talk. 

But since I don’t have any such product yet, 

I’ll create content out of a state of inspiration.

And build my own brand. 

And massive trust. 

Around myself. And marketing. 

So when I’m ready to launch my own product, 

I’ll have n number of people that I can sell to. 

**\-    -     -**
